records.location_details: A bus station near the border with Belarus in Lithuania. Specific location redacted.

records.location_text_raw: at a bus station close to [redacted] about [redacted] away from the border with Belarus.

possible_violations.legal_basis: art.18 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the EU
art. 19 (2) of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the EU

possible_violations.violation_name: Prohibition of inhuman and degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: art. 3 of the European Convention on Human Rights

records.context_note: A Moroccan migrant was apprehended at a bus station near the Lithuanian-Belarusian border by a joint patrol including Frontex officers. The migrant, who was observed limping, was subsequently directed back to Belarus. This action raised concerns about possible violations of the right to asylum, non-refoulement, and prohibition of inhuman and degrading treatment.
records.evidence_quote: On 11 April 2022, a joint patrol composed of a Lithuanian border guard and two Frontex officers were asked to assist in the search for an unknown person... The person was found, apprehended... and identified as a migrant... he was directed from the territory of Lithuania back to Belarus.
